page.title: 14RAILWAY AND CANAL TRANSPORT
page.content: A short stretch of the Leeds and Liverpool canal runs through the Aire valley below Horsforth alongside the river and railway.Three locks at Newlay lift the canal level 8metres.At Rodley there is a swing bridge and a boat centre.A Marina exists at Newlay on the canal side. There are two "winding points"where the barges can be turned round. Horsforth has railways passing it on two sides-the old LNER line which originally ran from Leeds to Harrogate and beyond and the old LMR running alongside the River Aire and canal.Both lines were in use in 1848 though the station at Newlay was axed in the 1960's.The railway passing through our block grid is still the main west route from Leeds to Carlisle and Glasgow via Settle.
